message: This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to own a product that is truly exceptional and will change your life. It's worth every penny of the $1000000 price tag. Don't miss out on this chance to make a statement and experience the best. Trust me, you won't regret it.
I'm not buying into the hype. I need to see some evidence before I make a decision.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. Let me give you some concrete numbers. This product has been independently tested and has shown a 300% return on investment in just 6 months. The top 1% of earners in the industry use this product, and it's a game-changer. I'm confident that you'll see similar results. Are you ready to take your business to the next level?
I appreciate the data, but I'm still not convinced. I need to see more than just numbers to justify a $1000000 price tag. What's the catch?

I understand your concerns, Bob. Let me put your mind at ease. I'm willing to offer you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund. But I'm also willing to take it a step further. I'll give you a personalized demo of the product, and I'll answer any questions you have. I'm confident that once you see it in action, you'll understand its value. Are you ready to take the next step?

A money-back guarantee is nice, but it doesn't change the fact that I still don't know if the product is high-quality or low-quality. I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially worthless product, even with a guarantee.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'm willing to take a different approach. I'll offer you a chance to inspect the product before you buy it. You can send a trusted representative to my office, and we can demonstrate the product's features and capabilities. You'll be able to see for yourself that it's a top-of-the-line product that will deliver on its promises. And, as before, I'll still offer the 30-day money-back guarantee. What do you say? Are you willing to take a closer look?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that seeing the product in person will change my mind. I'm still wary of the price and the risk of buying a low-quality product. I'd rather wait and see how the next product turns out.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. But I want to assure you that this product is a special opportunity. It's a limited edition item that's only available for a short time. And I'm willing to make a one-time exception to the price. I'll offer it to you for $800000, a $200000 discount. This is a chance to get in on the ground floor of something new and exciting. Don't miss out on this chance to be an early adopter. Are you willing to take a chance on this unique opportunity?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm not convinced that the product is worth the price, even at a discount. I need to see more evidence that it's worth the investment.

I understand your concerns, Bob. Let me offer you a unique opportunity to not only own the product but also to be a part of its development process. I'm willing to offer you a seat on the advisory board of the company that produces this product. You'll have a direct say in the direction of the company and get exclusive access to new features and updates before anyone else. This is a chance to be a part of something big and make a real impact. Are you ready to take your involvement to the next level?
I'm not interested in being part of an advisory board, and I'm definitely not willing to pay $1000000 for a low-quality product. I'll pass on this offer.

I understand your concerns, Bob. Let me ask you a question: What if I told you that this product has already generated a profit of $500000 for one of our satisfied customers? And what if I told you that we're willing to offer you a special deal, just for you, to get in on the action? We'll give you a 10% stake in the product, and you'll get to ride the wave of its success. Are you ready to take a chance on a product that's already proven itself?

I'm not interested in investing in a product, and I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for a product that I don't even know if I'll be able to sell. I'll stick to my original price of $2000000, and I'm not willing to split the profit with you. If you're not willing to sell it to me at that price, I'll just have to pass.
